titleStmt.title: To EDMUND YATES,Edmund Yates (1831-94; Dictionary of National Biography), journalist and novelist. Son of the actors Frederick Henry (see Pilgrim Letters 2, p. 10n) and Elizabeth Yates (née Brunton); educated at Highgate School and in Germany; entered the Post Office 1847, the Head of Missing Letters 1862, retired 1872. Member of the Garrick Club, Dec 1848. Married Louisa Katherine Wilkinson 1853. Met CD in 1854 and became a close friend and protégé. Contributor to Household Words and All the Year Round. 5 NOVEMBER 1858

body.p: I am going to have an early dinner to day,CD came to London for the day, from Gad's Hill. See To Vincent Wanostrocht, in Pilgrim Letters 8, p. 696. and you will find me at the Albion3 at 1/2 past The Albion Tavern and Hotel, 26 Great Russell St., Covent Garden, opposite Drury Lane Theatre. CD dined there frequently..
